# categoryBitMask

**Instance Property**

A mask that defines which categories this light belongs to.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var categoryBitMask: UInt32 { get set }
```

```swift
var categoryBitMask: UInt32 { get set }
```

## Discussion

Every light in a scene can be assigned to up to 32 different categories, each corresponding to a bit in the bit mask. SpriteKit does not predefine any lighting categories, so it is up to you to define which values are used in your game. When a scene is rendered, a light’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKLightNode/categoryBitMask] property is compared to each sprite node’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKSpriteNode/lightingBitMask], [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKSpriteNode/shadowCastBitMask], and [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKSpriteNode/shadowedBitMask] properties to determine whether that sprite interacts with the light.

The default value is `0x00000001`.

## Determining Whether a Light Node Is Active

- **isEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the node is casting light.
